title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady was nearly signed by the Las Vegas Raiders as a quarterback in 2020, according to owner Mark Davis.
Brady ultimately joined the Buccaneers in 2020, despite heavy interest from the Raiders and other teams.
Brady became a minority owner of the Raiders in May 2023, now owning a 10% stake in the team.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd is now streaming on HBO Max.
'Highest 2 Lowest' featuring Denzel Washington is available on Apple TV+.
'Lilo & Stitch' live-action remake is streaming on Disney+.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers and Pete Carroll return to Foxborough as the Raiders play the Patriots without Bill Belichick.
Raiders head coach Pete Carroll praises Patriots' physical run game and highlights Drake Maye's scrambling ability.
Jakobi Meyers speaks about emotional return to New England and uncertainty over his trade request being honored.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown and YouTube streamer IShowSpeed participated in a live stream touring Boston, including reenacting the Boston Tea Party.
Brown and IShowSpeed engaged in activities like dumping tea into the water and competing in a foot race in Downtown Crossing.
Brown humorously challenged IShowSpeed to change his name after the race, later contesting the result in a social media post.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell, No. 4 pick in 2025 NFL Draft, set to debut for Patriots against Raiders.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's run blocking and finishing ability despite arm length concerns.
Campbell received high preseason grades in both pass (80.1) and run blocking (87.6) by Pro Football Focus.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Mike Vrabel acknowledges Bill Belichick's ban on Patriots scouts at UNC, stressing their choice and focusing on his team.
Bill Belichick, now coaching at UNC, reportedly banned Patriots scouts following a strained departure from the New England Patriots.
Patriots scouts can still request UNC film and information despite being barred from practices and games.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A URI student filed a federal lawsuit alleging she was filmed in a dorm unisex shower and the school defamed her.
The lawsuit claims URI was negligent, failing to implement adequate security measures and placing the student in a vulnerable position.
The woman identified James Paquette, who faces voyeurism charges, but URI reportedly misrepresented the incident as isolated.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss the Patriots' season opener against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is questionable for Sunday with an ankle injury, limited in Friday's practice.
The Patriots' secondary will face changes, with Alex Austin, Marcus Jones, and Carlton Davis expected to see action.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics teammate Jordan Walsh reports Jayson Tatum is moving better as he recovers from a ruptured Achilles tendon.
The Celtics have not set a timetable for Jayson Tatum's return following his surgery after the May injury.
Without Tatum, Boston's younger players are competing for increased roles due to offseason trades and exits.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Raiders are beginning a new era with head coach Pete Carroll and quarterback Geno Smith, both former Seahawks.
Maxx Crosby continues to be a standout player for the Raiders, excelling as both a pass rusher and run stopper.
Rookie running back Ashton Jeanty is favored to win Offensive Rookie of the Year, adding depth to the Raiders' backfield.
